newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates plunge on lack of interest.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates plunge on lack of interest.

text.p: Pakistan's money rates plunged on Saturday on lack of borrowing interest, and dealers said the week ended with surplus funds.

"Right from the begining, lenders were offering at 4.0 percent, but there was no major borrowing interest at these levels," a dealer at Standard Chartered Bank said. "Later some deals were struck between 1.0 and 3.0 percent."
Dealers said there was an inflow of about 1.4 billion rupees at the maturity of three-year federal investment bonds and, as a result, the week ended at 1.0 percent.
